meanings.definition: A game in which one team prevents the opposing team from scoring any points.
meanings.sent1: The baseball team celebrated their shutouts with high-fives and cheers.
meanings.sent2: The goalie's shutouts helped the team win the championship.
meanings.sent3: The shutouts in soccer made the other team practice harder for the next game.
meanings.sent4: Her shutouts in basketball were like walls that the opponents couldn't break through.
meanings.sent5: The shutouts in football were so impressive that the fans couldn't stop talking about them.

meanings.definition: The act of preventing someone from entering a place or participating in an activity.
meanings.sent1: The security guard's shutouts kept unauthorized people away from the event.
meanings.sent2: His shutouts at the party made sure only invited guests were allowed in.
meanings.sent3: The shutouts at the concert were so strict that even the band members needed passes.
meanings.sent4: Her shutouts at the club entrance were like a fortress against party crashers.
meanings.sent5: The shutouts at the museum ensured only ticket holders could enjoy the exhibits.

meanings.sent1: His shutouts of dessert left him feeling unsatisfied after dinner.
meanings.sent2: The shutouts of vacation plans disappointed the kids.
meanings.sent3: The shutouts of screen time led to protests from the children.
meanings.sent4: Her shutouts of extra credit assignments frustrated the students.
meanings.sent5: The shutouts of overtime pay caused dissatisfaction among the employees.
